business.headline: Sensex tumbles 700 points. Why is stock market falling despite strong GDP growth?The BSE Sensex was down 732.71 points to 80,718.30 around 9:25 am, while the NSE Nifty50 traded 197.45 points lower at 24,553.25. Most of the broader market indices also fell sharply amid a surge in volatility.

Leela Hotels vs Aegis Vopak listing: Which IPO will make stronger market debut?Leela Hotels and Aegis Vopak had their initial public offerings (IPOs) open for subscription from May 26 to May 28. While both IPOs were fully subscribed, they did not see very high demand during the bidding period.
Sensex, Nifty open lower as IT, metal stocks drag market despite good GDP dataThe S&P BSE Sensex declined 723 points to 80,728.03, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 191 points to 24,559.95 as of 9:25 am.

Stock market opening: Will Sensex, Nifty rally today after GDP numbers?India's economy grew by 7.4% in the January-March quarter, surprising many analysts. The growth was mainly driven by strong activity in the construction and manufacturing sectors.

Stocks to watch on June 2: IndiGo, Nykaa, Leela Hotels, Tata Motors, BPCLStocks such as Apollo Hospitals, IndiGo, Tata Motors, BPCL, Leela Hotels, and Aegis Vopak Terminals are expected to be in the spotlight, driven by recent news updates and their fourth-quarter earnings announcements.

Pankaj Tripathi joins Hyundai Motor India as brand ambassadorPankaj Tripathi is known for his roles in films and web series where he often plays characters that are relatable and grounded. Hyundai said this quality made him the right choice to represent the brand.

Air India in talks for another mega aircraft deal with Airbus, Boeing: SourcesThe plane orders come at a time when aircraft manufacturers are scrambling with supply chain issues leading to severe delays in aircraft delivery and a looming jet shortage.

Air India to move jet maintenance work from Turkey firm amid diplomatic tensionsAgainst the backdrop of Turkiye backing Pakistan and condemning India's strikes on terror camps in the neighbouring country in May, aviation security watchdog BCAS, on May 15, revoked the security clearance for Turkish company Celebi Airport Services India Pvt Ltd in the "interest of national security".

Fungus on food, expired goods: Zepto's Dharavi licence suspended over lapsesThe action against Zepto was taken after an inspection revealed fungal growth on food items, expired products, and unhygienic storage conditions.

IndiGo, Air France-KLM, Virgin Atlantic join hands to enhance travel to US, EuropeTo enhance air connectivity from India to Europe and North America, IndiGo, Delta Air Lines, Air France-KLM and Virgin Atlantic announced a partnership.

India orders IndiGo to end agreement with Turkish Airlines amid diplomatic tensionsThe Indian government has ordered IndiGo Airlines to terminate its damp lease agreement with Turkish Airlines by August 31. This decision comes in response to Turkey's continued support for Pakistan against India. The aviation regulator DGCA has granted a final three-month extension to the current lease, which was set to expire on May 31. IndiGo is currently operating two Boeing aircraft on damp lease from Turkish Airlines. The move is part of India's broader response to Turkey's actions, including supplying arms to Pakistan and condemning India's Operation Sindhu.

India reduces import tax on crude edible oils by 10% to bring down food pricesThe reduction in import tax will effectively bring down the total import duty on the three oils to 16.5 per cent from an earlier 27.5 per cent.

entertainment.headline: Bhool Chuk Maaf box office Day 10: Strong second Sunday for Rajkummar Rao's film'Bhool Chuk Maaf' wrapped up its second weekend on a good note. The Rajkummar Rao and Wamiqa Gabbi-starrer has got four days to enjoy a smooth run at the box office before 'Housefull 5' hits the screens.

Elvish Yadav's gang member Gullu wins MTV Roadies XX, takes home bike, Rs 10 lakh MTV Roadies XX: This was Elvish Yadav's first season as a gang member, and his team's Gullu won it for him. The contestant took a cash prize of Rs 10 lakh and a bike.

Assam's 9-year-old Binita Chetry bags third place on Britain's Got TalentAssam's Binita Chetry secured third position on 'Britain's Got Talent' 2025 final. Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma congratulated the nine-year-old on her achievement on social media.

Comedian Gaurav Gupta's banter with Pak fan at US show: Chalo Hanuman chalisa padhoComedian Gaurav Gupta recently took a jibe at a Pakistani fan during a stand-up show as part of his US-Canada comedy tour, which led to mixed reactions.

Aamir Khan on unexpected romance with Gauri Spratt: We met by mistake and connectedActor Aamir Khan opened up on his bond with his partner Gauri Spratt. He recalled meeting her unexpectedly as he had not expected to find love again at this age.
Shah Rukh Khan's ripped and tattooed avatar leaves fans amazedShah Rukh Khan recently stunned fans with a new avatar, showcasing a muscular physique and flaunting his tattoos.

Bohot sharafat se... Actor Mumtaz recalls Yash Chopra's marriage proposalVeteran actor Mumtaz recalled once being proposed by the late filmmaker Yash Chopra. The 77-year-old spoke about her priorities at that time as an aspirational young actor.

Aamir Khan calls marriage to Reena Dutta jawani ka josh: Timing was a mistakeActor Aamir Khan reflected upon 16 years of marriage to Reena Dutta. The actor shared that he doesn't regret marrying Reena, because in her, he found a friend for life, but the timing of the marriage.

BTS kicks off 2025 FESTA with laughter, legacy, and Bangtan vibesBTS has launched the '2025 BTS FESTA' to celebrate their 12th debut anniversary, marking a heartfelt and playful reunion stage for the group post military service. The event sets the tone for an eagerly awaited full-group comeback later this year or early next year.

Actor Sreeleela sits in basket, shares family celebration before birthday. PicsActor Sreeleela shared a nostalgic pre-birthday post on social media with her family. In the pictures, she is seen dressed traditionally, sitting in a basket as her family members shower her with blessings and love.

Time exposes, says director Raj Nidimoru's wife amid rumours of him dating SamanthaAs the rumours of Samantha dating director Raj Nidimoru spread on social media, his wife, Shyyamali De, shared a cryptic note on Instagram, mentioning 'karma' and 'time'.

Hope I die with my shoes on: Aamir Khan says Mahabharat could be his last spectacleAamir Khan recently spoke about the possibility of his ambitious project based on the epic Mahabharat. He also hinted at it being the final film project of his career after 'Sitaare Zameen Par'. The actor reflected on the reason why he felt so.

Stranger Things 5 to have 3 parts: Plot, cast, release date - all you need to know'Stranger Things Season 5' finale will release on New Year's Eve. Netflix has split the last season into three parts. Here's all you need to know about one of the most celebrated fantasy thrillers.

Indian TV was better in the 90s - and it's not just nostalgiaWhen television was a reflection of life, not a cacophony of drama and excess, the golden era of Indian TV in the 90s brought stories that resonated with the soul and characters that felt like family.

Accepting blessings again: Actor Nakuul Mehta, Jankee announce second pregnancy'Ishqbaaz' star Nakuul Mehta is going to welcome his second child with wife Jankee soon. The couple announced good news with a few pictures on social media.

Bees Saal Baad: Timeless mystery of an English babu, village belle, and desi ghostDecades may have passed, but the eerie echoes of 'Bees Saal Baad' still send a chill down the spine - proof that true horror never fades, it lingers.

Himesh Reshammiya praises Paresh Rawal for Hera Pheri mid-concertDurig his concert in Mumbai, singer Himesh Reshammiya, before breaking into the 'Jumme Raat' song, started praising actor Paresh Rawal for his performances in the 'Hera Pheri' movies.

Squid Game 3 trailer: Equal parts chilling and excitingSeveral characters who were not given enough screen time in Season 2, reappear in Season 3 with more. The trailer of 'Squid Game Season 3' features deadlier games and an iconic face-off.

Won't allow Thug Life's release: Protests against Kamal Haasan intensifyActor Kamal Haasan's effigies were burnt across Karnataka as protests against the actor intensified amid the language row. His film, 'Thug Life', is scheduled to release on June 5.

general news.headline: People set on fire in Colorado attack; FBI calls it targeted terrorIn the video of the incident that went viral on social media, the suspect, Mohamed Sabry Soliman, can be seen shouting at pro-Israeli protesters, asking, 'How many children have you killed?' while holding a flamethrower in one hand and a Molotov cocktail in the other.

117 drones, 18-month planning: Zelenskyy details 'brilliant op' deep into RussiaA day before the scheduled peace talks, Ukrainian forces launched one of their most daring and successful attacks on Russian soil, striking dozens of strategic bombers at airbases located thousands of kilometres behind the front lines.

Video: Magnus Carlsen punches table after crushing defeat against D GukeshNorway Open: Magnus Carlsen stormed off after punching the table in frustration as world champion D Gukesh registered his first-ever over-the-board classical win against the Norwegian stalwart on Sunday.

Sensational Shreyas Iyer floors MI, fires Punjab into IPL final after 11 yearsIPL 2025 Qualifier 1: Shreyas Iyer smashed 87 off 41 balls in one of his greatest knocks as Punjab Kings chased 204 successfully against Mumbai Indians. PBKS will face Royal Challengers Bengaluru on Tuesday, June 3.

Baloch women now face brutality of Pakistani establishmentThe enforced disappearance of 24-year-old Mahjabeen Baloch last week marks an escalation. Baloch women are now being targeted by the Pakistani establishment in the same brutal way as Baloch men, children, and the elderly. There's a disturbing rise in enforced disappearances of women activists in Balochistan.

Over 500 civilians rescued by Army, Assam Rifles in flood-struck ManipurThe personnel rescued civilians from severely inundated areas such as Wangkhei, Heingang, Lamlong, Khurai, JNIMS and Ahallup, officials said.

News Menu, June 2: PM at Air Transport Summit; escalating Russia-Ukraine warFiery row over top Army General's Operation Sindoor remarks, Ukraine's dramatic drone strikes on Russia, PM Modi's address at an event on air transport is in India Today's news menu for today.

Israel shares clip accusing gunmen of shooting at Gaza aid site, blames HamasThe Israel Defence Forces (IDF) released drone footage purportedly showing Hamas gunmen firing at the crowds, asserting that the incident was a deliberate effort to sabotage humanitarian efforts.

Video: Colorado 'terror' suspect faces furious locals after firebombingA man was arrested after allegedly throwing Molotov cocktail-like liquid at a pro-Israel group in Boulder, injuring several. FBI Director Kash Patel called it a "targeted terror attack," though police say it's too early to confirm the motive.

Why Pakistan-fired PL-15E missile's debris in India is China's worryThe remnants, while proving China's role in the India-Pakistan conflict, open up reverse-engineering potential for New Delhi to bolster its own missile programmes

Aadhaar fraud in police constable exam: Munna Bhai-style scam in Madhya PradeshThe cheating was uncovered during document verification prior to joining, when the photograph on the exam records did not match the current Aadhaar photo.

Hidden in sheds, moved by trucks: How Ukrainian drones rained fire on RussiaAccording to a Ukrainian security official, who spoke to Reuters, the operation - code-named 'Spider's Web' - targeted four Russian airbases and marked the deepest drone assault Ukraine has launched to date.

Assam's 9-year-old Binita Chetry bags third place on Britain's Got TalentAssam's Binita Chetry secured third position on 'Britain's Got Talent' 2025 final. Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma congratulated the nine-year-old on her achievement on social media.
Luxury items, cash and more found in ex-MP's barrack in UP's Lalitpur jailA surprise raid at Lalitpur Jail exposed ex-MP Rizwan Zaheer living in luxury with cash, branded goods and VVIP perks.

Emotional Preity Zinta celebrates with Shreyas Iyer after PBKS reach IPL 2025 finalAn emotional Preity Zinta celebrated with PBKS skipper Shreyas Iyer as Punjab reached the final of IPL 2025 with a five-wicket win over Mumbai Indians on Sunday, June 1. Punjab will face RCB in the final on June 3.

Caught on camera: Flight turbulence due to Delhi dust storm, pilot aborts landingA video recorded by an IndiGo passenger inside the Raipur-Delhi flight surfaced on social media, capturing the moment of turbulence as the plane shook mid-air due to a dust storm in the national capital.
Eye patches look cool, scream self-care. But do they work?Alia Bhatt to Anne Hathaway, celebrities love flaunting eye patches. But are they a must-have in your glow-up essentials kit?

Allies no longer expect us to go around with begging bowl: Pak PM's big admissionAdmitting that his country had turned to allies with a "begging bowl" to shore up its financial reserves, Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif said the partner countries no longer expected Islamabad to do so.

Hours before Istanbul talks, Ukraine sends peace accord memorandum to RussiaRussia has received Ukraine's draft memorandum for an agreement ahead of peace talks in Istanbul. The meeting aims to narrow differences and move toward a ceasefire in the ongoing conflict.

Watch: Shreyas Iyer's angry outburst at Shashank after match-winning knock vs MIPunjab Kings (PBKS) captain Shreyas Iyer was seen fuming at teammate Shashank Singh following his match-winning innings against Mumbai Indians (MI) in the Qualifier 2 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

Hardik Pandya sinks to ground, takes the blame after Mumbai lose Qualifier 2Mumbai Indians captain Hardik Pandya sank into his haunches after Shreyas Iyer struck the winning runs, helping Punjab Kings knock Mumbai Indians out of IPL 2025 and set up the title clash against Royal Challengers Bangalore in Ahmedabad.

Biden killed, replaced by clone in 2020: Trump's bizarre conspiracy theoryUS President's Truth Social post claims Joe Biden was executed five years ago and was replaced with 'soulless, mindless entities'.

Assault on free speech: Bar Council of India seeks release of Sharmishta PanoliMishra accused the West Bengal government and Kolkata Police of selective and politically driven action, targeting certain communities while ignoring or shielding worse offenses by others.

49-year-old saved after live heart travels 17 km in 19 minutes for transplant in DelhiThe 17-kilometre journey, made possible by a dedicated green corridor, took place between 11:40 AM and 11:59 AM, enabling a life-saving transplant for a critically ill 49-year-old patient.

sports.headline: PBKS vs MI: Mahela Jayawardene rues dropped chances after losing Qualifier 2Mumbai Indians (MI) head coach Mahela Jayawardene was left ruing dropped chances following his team's five-wicket loss against Punjab Kings (PBKS) in Qualifier 2 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

Shreyas Iyer's triple treat, MI's 200 fortress breached: IPL Qualifier 2 in statsShreyas Iyer made IPL history by becoming the first captain to lead three different teams—Delhi Capitals (2020), Kolkata Knight Riders (2024), and Punjab Kings (2025)—to the final. Meanwhile, Punjab Kings shattered Mumbai Indians' longstanding fortress by successfully chasing a record 204 runs in Qualifier 2, setting the highest-ever chase in IPL knockout history.

Watch: Shreyas Iyer's angry outburst at Shashank after match-winning knock vs MIPunjab Kings (PBKS) captain Shreyas Iyer was seen fuming at teammate Shashank Singh following his match-winning innings against Mumbai Indians (MI) in the Qualifier 2 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

Told Virat Kohli to ease emotions in IPL, he didn't follow advice: AB de VilliersAB de Villiers revealed that he told Virat Kohli to try and play a season in the IPL while toning down on his emotions on the field. De Villiers said that Kohli heard the advice and decided not to use it.

Shot of the IPL! AB de Villiers raves as Shreyas Iyer diffuses Bumrah yorkerLegendary South Africa cricketer AB de Villiers reserved his highest praise for Shreyas Iyer after his match-winning innings of 87* (41) against Mumbai Indians (MI) in Qualifier 2 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

Throw it in the bin: How Shreyas Iyer, PBKS overcame RCB qualifier 1 lossPBKS skipper Shreyas Iyer explained how his side were able to overcome their big loss to RCB in the Qualifier 1 to come back and beat MI to reach the final of IPL 2025. Shreyas was the star of the show as Punjab reached the final for the first time in 11 years.

Emotional Preity Zinta celebrates with Shreyas Iyer after PBKS reach IPL 2025 finalAn emotional Preity Zinta celebrated with PBKS skipper Shreyas Iyer as Punjab reached the final of IPL 2025 with a five-wicket win over Mumbai Indians on Sunday, June 1. Punjab will face RCB in the final on June 3.

Hardik Pandya sinks to ground, takes the blame after Mumbai lose Qualifier 2Mumbai Indians captain Hardik Pandya sank into his haunches after Shreyas Iyer struck the winning runs, helping Punjab Kings knock Mumbai Indians out of IPL 2025 and set up the title clash against Royal Challengers Bangalore in Ahmedabad.

Sensational Shreyas Iyer floors MI, fires Punjab into IPL final after 11 yearsIPL 2025 Qualifier 1: Shreyas Iyer smashed 87 off 41 balls in one of his greatest knocks as Punjab Kings chased 204 successfully against Mumbai Indians. PBKS will face Royal Challengers Bengaluru on Tuesday, June 3.

Video: Magnus Carlsen punches table after crushing defeat against D GukeshNorway Open: Magnus Carlsen stormed off after punching the table in frustration as world champion D Gukesh registered his first-ever over-the-board classical win against the Norwegian stalwart on Sunday.

Carlos Alcaraz outlasts Ben Shelton, becomes 2nd fastest to 100 wins on clayDefending champion Carlos Alcaraz secured his 100th tour-level victory on clay by defeating American Ben Shelton in a thrilling fourth-round battle to reach the quarter-finals.

Emotional Preity Zinta celebrates with Shreyas Iyer after PBKS reach IPL 2025 finalAn emotional Preity Zinta celebrated with PBKS skipper Shreyas Iyer as Punjab reached the final of IPL 2025 with a five-wicket win over Mumbai Indians on Sunday, June 1. Punjab will face RCB in the final on June 3.

Hardik Pandya sinks to ground, takes the blame after Mumbai lose Qualifier 2Mumbai Indians captain Hardik Pandya sank into his haunches after Shreyas Iyer struck the winning runs, helping Punjab Kings knock Mumbai Indians out of IPL 2025 and set up the title clash against Royal Challengers Bangalore in Ahmedabad.

Sensational Shreyas Iyer floors MI, fires Punjab into IPL final after 11 yearsIPL 2025 Qualifier 1: Shreyas Iyer smashed 87 off 41 balls in one of his greatest knocks as Punjab Kings chased 204 successfully against Mumbai Indians. PBKS will face Royal Challengers Bengaluru on Tuesday, June 3.

Video: Magnus Carlsen punches table after crushing defeat against D GukeshNorway Open: Magnus Carlsen stormed off after punching the table in frustration as world champion D Gukesh registered his first-ever over-the-board classical win against the Norwegian stalwart on Sunday.

Carlos Alcaraz outlasts Ben Shelton, becomes 2nd fastest to 100 wins on clayDefending champion Carlos Alcaraz secured his 100th tour-level victory on clay by defeating American Ben Shelton in a thrilling fourth-round battle to reach the quarter-finals.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
